code: @Manual{,   title = {DataTools: Data Tools for Shiny Apps},   author = {Antonia Runge},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 24.05.1.2},   url = {https://pandora-isomemo.github.io/data-tools/}, }

title: Data Tools for Shiny Apps
text: functions modules can applied across Isomemo Apps, app test modules.

title: Data Tools for Shiny Apps
text: see NEWS.md

title: Data Tools for Shiny Apps
text: Access uploads file, url, Pandora Platform. Optionally, merge data import via UI SQL. UI function : Server function: Example apply UI server function shiny module: https://github.com/Pandora-IsoMemo/data-tools/blob/91a16dd78bdada382e378d78eb218bb8b815f1bc/R/01-toolsPanel.R#L13 https://github.com/Pandora-IsoMemo/data-tools/blob/91a16dd78bdada382e378d78eb218bb8b815f1bc/R/01-toolsPanel.R#L31-L37 Functions check validity imports:
code: DataTools::importDataUI(id, label = "Import Data") DataTools::importDataServer(id, rowNames = NULL, colNames = NULL, customWarningChecks = list(), customErrorChecks = list(), ignoreWarnings = FALSE, defaultSource = "ckan") DataTools::checkWarningEmptyValues(data) DataTools::checkAnyNonNumericColumns(data) DataTools::checkErrorNoNumericColumns(data)

title: Data Tools for Shiny Apps
text: function catch forward errors warnings app’s UI

title: Data Tools for Shiny Apps
text: Numbers Prefix. Grouped files type functionality. Lower number indicate functions closer functionality app / higher abstraction level 00: Start application / main functionality / Namespace 01: Main shiny modules (basically tabs app) 02: Helper shiny modules (files include ui + server component) 03: Helper functions

title: downUploadButton module server — downUploadButtonServer
code: downUploadButtonServer(   id,   dat,   inputs,   model,   rPackageName,   githubRepo,   mainFolder = "predefinedModels",   subFolder = NULL,   fileExtension = "zip",   helpHTML = "",   modelNotes = reactive(""),   onlySettings = FALSE,   compress = TRUE,   compressionLevel = 9,   reset = reactive(FALSE),   title = "Download and Upload of Models",   labelRemote = "Load online model",   labelLocal = "Load local model" )

title: downUploadButton module server — downUploadButtonServer
text: id module id dat (reactive) user data inputs (reactiveValues) reactiveValues list user inputs, cases just "inputs" list model (reactive) model output object rPackageName (character) name package (Description file) module called. NULL, uploaded file must downloaded file R package importDataServer called. parameter ignored importType == "data". githubRepo (character) name used github repository, e.g. "bpred" mainFolder (character) folder containing loadable .zip files. apps folder "predefinedModels". apps can found "inst/app/". subFolder (character) (optional) subfolder containing loadable .zip files fileExtension (character) (optional) app specific file extension, e.g. "resources", "bpred", "bmsc" helpHTML content help function modelNotes (reactive) notes regarding object saved displayed uploaded onlySettings (logical) TRUE allow download user inputs user data compress logical specifying whether saving named file use "gzip" compression, one "gzip", "bzip2" "xz" indicate type compression used. Ignored file connection. compressionLevel number 1 9. 9 compresses best, also takes longest. reset (reactive) resets selection online files title title used inside modal labelRemote label input remote files labelLocal label input local files

title: Server function download model — downloadModelServer
code: downloadModelServer(   id,   dat,   inputs,   model,   rPackageName,   subFolder = NULL,   customFileName = reactive(""),   defaultFileName = "",   fileExtension = "zip",   helpHTML = "",   modelNotes = reactive(""),   triggerUpdate = reactive(TRUE),   onlySettings = FALSE,   compress = TRUE,   compressionLevel = 9 )

title: Server function download model — downloadModelServer
text: id namespace id dat (reactive) user data inputs (reactiveValues) reactiveValues list user inputs, cases just "inputs" list model (reactive) model output object rPackageName (character) name package (Description file) module called. NULL, uploaded file must downloaded file R package importDataServer called. parameter ignored importType == "data". subFolder (character) (optional) subfolder containing loadable .zip files customFileName (reactive) custom file name, empty ("") default file name used. example, reactive name updated model uploaded app. defaultFileName (character) default file name, empty ("") default file name created containing current time fileExtension (character) (optional) app specific file extension, e.g. "resources", "bpred", "bmsc" helpHTML content help function modelNotes (reactive) notes regarding object saved displayed uploaded triggerUpdate (reactive) trigger update "Notes" text input. Useful, applying module inside modal window. onlySettings (logical) TRUE allow download user inputs user data compress logical specifying whether saving named file use "gzip" compression, one "gzip", "bzip2" "xz" indicate type compression used. Ignored file connection. compressionLevel number 1 9. 9 compresses best, also takes longest.

what: Server function for data import — importDataServer
title: Server function for data import — importDataServer
text: Backend data import module

title: Server function for data import — importDataServer
code: importDataServer(   id,   title = "",   defaultSource = c("ckan", "file", "url", "remoteModel"),   ckanFileTypes = c("xls", "xlsx", "csv", "odt", "txt"),   ignoreWarnings = FALSE,   importType = c("data", "model", "zip"),   rowNames = reactiveVal(NULL),   colNames = reactiveVal(NULL),   customWarningChecks = list(),   customErrorChecks = list(),   batch = FALSE,   outputAsMatrix = FALSE,   fileExtension = "zip",   mainFolder = NULL,   subFolder = NULL,   rPackageName = "",   onlySettings = FALSE,   expectedFileInZip = c(),   options = importOptions() )

title: Server function for data import — importDataServer
text: id namespace id title title data import module defaultSource (character) default source input "Source", e.g. "ckan", "file", "url" ckanFileTypes (character) file types allowed import Pandora ("ckan") ignoreWarnings TRUE enable imports case warnings importType (character) type import, either "data" "model" "zip". ImportType == "zip" enables optional parameter 'expectedFileInZip'. rowNames (reactive) use rownames imported data. parameter ignored importType == "model" colNames (reactive) use colnames imported data. parameter ignored importType == "model" customWarningChecks list reactive(!) functions executed importing data.  functions need return TRUE check successful character warning otherwise.  parameter ignored importType == "model" customErrorChecks list reactive(!) functions executed importing data.   functions need return TRUE check successful character warning otherwise.   parameter ignored importType == "model" batch (logical) use batch import. parameter ignored importType == "model" outputAsMatrix (logical) TRUE output must matrix, e.g. batch = TRUE Resources. parameter ignored importType == "model" fileExtension (character) (otional) app specific file extension, e.g. "resources", "bmsc", "bpred", (app-unspecific) "zip". files extension valid import. mainFolder (character) DEPRECATED. folder containing loadable .zip files. parameter ignored importType == "data" subFolder (character) (optional) subfolder containing loadable .zip files. parameter ignored importType == "data" rPackageName (character) DEPRECATED. Instead, please use options = importOptions(rPackageName = <package>). onlySettings (logical) TRUE allow upload user inputs user data. parameter ignored importType == "data" expectedFileInZip (character) (optional) parameter ignored importType != "zip". File names must contained zip upload. options (list) Extra options import module.

title: Import Options — importOptions
text: Extra options import module.

title: Import Options — importOptions
text: rPackageName (character) name package (Description file) module called. NULL, uploaded file must downloaded file R package importDataServer called. parameter ignored importType == "data". customHelpText (list) help text element can added UI definition. Output shiny::helpText(...).

what: Set up the authentication with your API key — rgpt_authenticate
title: Set up the authentication with your API key — rgpt_authenticate
text: Access GPT's functions requires API key obtain [https://openai.com/api/](https://openai.com/api/). `rgpt_authenticate()` looks API key file provide path ensures can connect models. `rgpt_endsession()` overwrites API key _for session_ (recommended run done). `check_apikey_form()` simple check information provided . function copied https://github.com/ben-aaron188/rgpt3.

title: Set up the authentication with your API key — rgpt_authenticate
Set up the authentication with your API key — rgpt_authenticate
text: path file path API key

title: Set up the authentication with your API key — rgpt_authenticate
text: confirmation message

title: Set up the authentication with your API key — rgpt_authenticate
text: easiest way store API key `.txt` file _only_ API key (without quotation marks common string indicators). `rgpt_authenticate()` reads single file point retrieves content authentication key requests.

what: Makes a single chat completion request to the GPT API for all chat models — rgpt_single
title: Makes a single chat completion request to the GPT API for all chat models — rgpt_single
text: `rgpt_single()` sends single [chat completion request](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/chat) Open AI GPT API. function allows specify role content API call.  function copied https://github.com/ben-aaron188/rgpt3.

title: Makes a single chat completion request to the GPT API for all chat models — rgpt_single
code: rgpt_single(   prompt_role = "user",   prompt_content,   seed = NULL,   model = "gpt-4-0125-preview",   output_type = "complete",   max_tokens = 100,   temperature = 1,   top_p = 1,   n = 1,   stop = NULL,   presence_penalty = 0,   frequency_penalty = 0,   logprobs = FALSE )

title: Makes a single chat completion request to the GPT API for all chat models — rgpt_single
text: prompt_role character (default: 'user') contains role prompt message GPT (chat) message format. Must one 'system', assistant', 'user' (default), see [https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/chat](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/chat) prompt_content character contains content prompt message GPT (chat) message format, see [https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/chat](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/chat). key instruction GPT model receives. seed numeric (optional) seed control reproducibility completions. NULL, seed used results may differ completion. See: [https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-seed](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-seed) model character vector indicates [GPT model](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models/gpt-4--gpt-4-turbo) use; currently supported : 'gpt-3.5-turbo-0125', 'gpt-3.5-turbo', 'gpt-3.5-turbo-1106', 'gpt-3.5-turbo-16k', 'gpt-3.5-turbo-0613', 'gpt-3.5-turbo-16k-0613', 'gpt-4', 'gpt-4-0613', 'gpt-4-0125-preview' '(default, = GPT-4 Turbo) output_type character determining output provided: "complete" '(default), "text" "meta" max_tokens numeric (default: 100) indicating maximum number tokens completion request return (official API documentation: _The maximum number tokens allowed generated answer. default, number tokens model can return '(4096 - prompt tokens)._) temperature numeric (default: 1.0) specifying sampling strategy possible completions (official API documentation: _What sampling temperature use, 0 2. Higher values like 0.8 make output random, lower values like 0.2 make focused deterministic. generally recommend altering `top_p` ._) top_p numeric (default: 1) specifying sampling strategy alternative temperature sampling (official API documentation: _An alternative sampling temperature, called nucleus sampling, model considers results tokens top_p probability mass. 0.1 means tokens comprising top 10 considered. generally recommend altering `temperature` ._) n numeric (default: 1) specifying number completions per request (official API documentation: _How many chat completion choices generate input message. **Note: parameter generates many completions, can quickly consume token quota.** Use carefully ensure reasonable settings max_tokens stop._) stop character character vector (default: NULL) specifies character value completion end (official API documentation: _Up 4 sequences API stop generating tokens._) presence_penalty numeric (default: 0) -2.00  +2.00 determine penalisation repetitiveness token already exists (official API documentation: _Number -2.0 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based whether appear text far, increasing model's likelihood talk new topics._). See also: [https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details](https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details) frequency_penalty numeric (default: 0) -2.00  +2.00 determine penalisation repetitiveness based frequency token text already (official API documentation: _Number -2.0 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based existing frequency text far, decreasing model's likelihood repeat line verbatim._). See also: [https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details](https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details) logprobs boolean (default: TRUE) official API documentation: : _whether return log probabilities output tokens . true, returns log probabilities output token returned content message._ returned output list slot 3.

title: Makes a single chat completion request to the GPT API for all chat models — rgpt_single
text: list three data tables (`output_type` default "complete"): [[1]] contains data table columns `n` (= mo. `n` responses requested), `prompt_role` (= role set prompt), `prompt_content` (= content set prompt), `rgpt_role` (= role GPT model assumed chat completion) `rgpt_content` (= content GPT model provided assumed role chat completion). [[2]] contains meta information request, including request id, parameters request token usage prompt (`tok_usage_prompt`), completion (`tok_usage_completion`), total usage (`tok_usage_total`), system fingerprint (`system_fingerprint`) (reproducibility related seed). [[3]] contains tokens completion (per n requests applicable) corresponding log probabilities. `output_type` "text", data table slot [[1]] returned. `output_type` "meta", data table slot [[2]] returned. `output_type` "logprobs", data table slot [[3]] returned.

title: Makes a single chat completion request to the GPT API for all chat models — rgpt_single
text: general guide completion requests, see [https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat). function provides R wrapper send requests full range request parameters detailed [https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions](https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions) reproduced . Parameters included/supported:   - `logit_bias`: [https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat/create-logit_bias](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat/create-logit_bias)   - `stream`: [https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat/create-stream](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat/create-stream) # First authenticate API key via `rgpt_authenticate('pathtokey')` # authenticated: ## Simple request defaults: `rgpt_single(prompt_content = 'teacher: explain science ')` ## Instruct GPT model write ten research ideas max. 150 tokens controls: `rgpt_single(prompt_role = 'user', prompt_content = 'Write research idea using text data understand human behaviour:' , temperature = 0.8 , n = 10 , max_tokens = 150)` ## fully reproducible results, need set seed, e.g., `seed = 42`, e.g.: `rgpt_single(prompt_content = 'Finish sentence: easier way learn R ' , temperature = 0.7 , seed = 42 , max_tokens = 50)`

title: Select Data Server — selectDataServer
code: selectDataServer(   id,   importType = "data",   mergeList,   customNames,   dataSource,   subFolder = NULL,   ignoreWarnings = FALSE,   rPackageName = "",   onlySettings = FALSE,   fileExtension = "zip",   expectedFileInZip = c() )

title: Select Data Server — selectDataServer
text: id id module importType (character) type import, either "data" "model" "zip". ImportType == "zip" enables optional parameter 'expectedFileInZip'. mergeList (reactiveVal) list data imports submitted data processing via buttons 'Create Query data' 'Prepare / Merge data' customNames settings custom column row names dataSource (reactiveValues) path, filename, type input, output selectSourceServer() subFolder (character) (optional) subfolder containing loadable .zip files. parameter ignored importType == "data" ignoreWarnings TRUE enable imports case warnings rPackageName (character) DEPRECATED. Instead, please use options = importOptions(rPackageName = <package>). onlySettings (logical) TRUE allow upload user inputs user data. parameter ignored importType == "data" fileExtension (character) (otional) app specific file extension, e.g. "resources", "bmsc", "bpred", (app-unspecific) "zip". files extension valid import. expectedFileInZip (character) (optional) parameter ignored importType != "zip". File names must contained zip upload.
